Package org.ivoa.dm.stc.coords

Class TimeOffset

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ivoa.dm.stc.coords.Coordinate
      • org.ivoa.dm.stc.coords.TimeStamp
        • org.ivoa.dm.stc.coords.TimeOffset
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.ivoa.vodml.jpa.JPAManipulations
    @Embeddable
@VoDml(id="coords:TimeOffset",
       role=dataType)
public class TimeOffset
extends TimeStamp
implements org.ivoa.vodml.jpa.JPAManipulations
    Time is given as an offset from a specific point in time (time0). dataType: TimeOffset

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  TimeOffset.TimeOffsetBuilder
      A builder class for TimeOffset, mainly for use in the functional builder pattern.

        @VoDml(id="coords:TimeOffset.time",
       role=attribute,
       type="ivoa:RealQuantity",
       typeRole=dataType)
protected org.ivoa.dm.ivoa.RealQuantity time
        The TimeOffset coordinate value. : Attribute time : multiplicity 1

      • time0

        @VoDml(id="coords:TimeOffset.time0",
       role=attribute,
       type="coords:TimeInstant",
       typeRole=dataType)
protected TimeInstant time0
        The reference time from which the offset is calculated. This MUST be given as a TimeInstant (e.g.: JD, MJD, ISOTime). : Attribute time0 : multiplicity 1

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimeOffset

        public TimeOffset()
        Creates a new TimeOffset

      • TimeOffset

        public TimeOffset​(org.ivoa.dm.ivoa.RealQuantity time,
                  TimeInstant time0,
                  TimeSys coordSys)
        full parameter constructor.
        Parameters:
        time - The TimeOffset coordinate value.
        time0 - The reference time from which the offset is calculated. This MUST be given as a TimeInstant (e.g.: JD, MJD, ISOTime).
        coordSys - Provided additional metadata relevant to interpreting the coordinate value; for example, the spatial reference position, or time scale, axis descriptions.

      • TimeOffset

        Copy Constructor. Note that references will remain as is rather than be copied.

        time - The TimeOffset coordinate value.
        time0 - The reference time from which the offset is calculated. This MUST be given as a TimeInstant (e.g.: JD, MJD, ISOTime).
